docs.summary:
The wix-crm-backend module contains functionality for working with
 your site's [workflows](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-workflows)
 from backend code.

 A workflow consists of a number of phases, also known as steps. The final phase
 in the workflow, the phase that indicates the workflow has been completed,
 is know as the win phase. Each phase can contain cards that move between the phases,
 indicating the card's progression through the workflow.
description: To use the Workflows API, import `wixCrm` from the `wix-crm-backend` module:
```javascript
import wixCrm from 'wix-crm-backend';

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the card to archive.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the card has been archived.

docs.summary: Archives a workflow card.
description: The `archiveCard()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the
card has been archived.

examples.title: Archive a card
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to void.

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow to create the card in.

params.name: phaseId
params.doc: ID of the phase to create the card in.

params.name: card
params.doc: The data to use when creating the card.

params.name: position
params.doc: The created card's position within the workflow.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - ID of the newly created card.

docs.summary: Creates a new workflow card.
description: The `createCard()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the created card's
ID when the card is created in the specified workflow phase.
Pass a value for the `position` parameter to specify the newly created card's
position within the specified phase. Positions are zero-based, meaning the first position is`0`.
When omitted, the newly created card is added to the specified phase as the top card within the phase.

examples.title: Create a card
body: export function createCard(workflowId, phaseId, contactId, position = undefined){
// Returns a promise that resolves to:

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow to add the new phase to.

params.name: phase
params.doc: The data required for phase creation.

params.name: position
params.doc: The created phase's position within the workflow.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - ID of the newly created phase.

docs.summary: Creates a new workflow phase.
description: The `createPhase()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the created phase
ID when the phase is created in the specified workflow.
Pass a value for the `position` parameter to specify the newly created phase's
position within the specified workflow. Positions are zero-based, meaning the first position is `0`.
When omitted, the newly created phase is added as the last non-win phase.

params.name: workflowId
params.doc: ID of the workflow to retrieve cards from.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options to use when getting the list of cards.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - List of retrieved cards.

docs.summary: Gets a list of a workflow's cards.
description: The `listCards()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of the
the specified workflow's cards.
Use the `options` parameter to specify which cards to retrieve and in which
order to retrieve them. Cards can be sorted based on their `"id"`, `"name"`,
`"phaseId"`, `"createdDate"`, `"updatedDate"`, `"source"`, and `"position"`.
If no `limit` parameter is passed, the first 50 cards are returned. Sort order
defaults to by `"phaseId"` and then by `"position"` ascending.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - List of retrieved workflows.

Use the `options` parameter to specify which phases to retrieve. If no `options`
parameter is passed, the first 50 phases are returned.

docs.summary: Gets a list of a workflow's phases.
description: The `listPhasesInfo()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list containing
information about the specified workflow's phases.
Use the `options` parameter to specify which phases to retrieve and in which
order to retrieve them. Phases can be sorted based on their `"id"`, `"name"`, and
`"position"`. If no `limit` parameter is passed, the first 50 cards are returned.
Sort order defaults to by `"position"` ascending.

body: /* Returns a promise that resolves to:

params.doc: Options to use when getting the list of workflows.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - List of retrieved workflow info.

docs.summary: Gets a list of the site's workflows info.
description: The `listWorkflowsInfo()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list containing
information about the site's workflows.
Use the `options` parameter to specify which workflows to retrieve and in which
order to retrieve them. Workflows can be sorted based on their `"name"`.
If no `limit` parameter is passed, the first 100 workflows are returned. Sort order
defaults to by `"name"` ascending.

params.name: cardId
params.doc: ID of the card to move.

params.name: options
params.doc: Information about where to move the card.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the card has moved.

docs.summary: Moves a card to a new position within a workflow.
description: The `moveCard()` function returns a Promise when the specified card
has been moved to the new position.
Use the [`options`](#MoveCardOptions) parameter to specify the phase
and position within that phase to move the card to. Positions are zero-based,
meaning the first position is `0`.

examples.title: Move a card
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to void.

params.name: id
params.doc: ID of the phase to move.

params.name: options
params.doc: Information about where to move the phase.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - When the phase has moved.

docs.summary: Moves a phase to a new position with a workflow.
description: The `movePhase()` function returns a Promise when the specified phase
has been moved to the new position.
Use the [`options`](#MovePhaseOptions) parameter to specify the new phase
position within the workflow. Any non-win phase can be moved to any non-win position. The win phase cannot
be moved. Positions are zero-based, meaning the first position is `0`.

examples.title: Move a phase
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to void.

docs.summary: Updates an existing workflow card.
description: The `updateCardFields()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the
card has been updated with the specified values.
Only the properties passed in the [`Card`](#Card) object will be
updated. All other properties will remain the same.

description: The `updateWorkflowFields()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the
workflow has been updated with the specified values.
may be ordered by the following fields: id, name, createdDate
Only the properties passed in the [`Workflow`](#Workflow) object will be
updated. All other properties will remain the same.

docs.summary: An object containing card information.

examples.title: Gets a card
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the card.

members.name: id
members.doc: Unique card identifier.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: ID of the contact associated with the card.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date the card was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date the card was last updated.

members.name: source
members.doc:
Source that created the card.

 One of:

 + `"Contacts"`
 + `"Inbox"`
 + `"Invoices"`
 + `"Price Quotes"`
 + `"Wix Forms"`

members.name: phaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase which contains the card.

docs.summary: An object containing a list of cards and pagination info.

examples.title: Get a list of cards
body: /* Returns a promise that resolves to:

members.name: items
members.doc: List of cards matching the list options.

members.name: length
members.doc: Number of items in the current results page.

members.name: totalCount
members.doc: Total number of cards in the specified workflow and phase.

members.name: pageSize
members.doc: Number of items returned per page with the current list options.

members.name: totalPages
members.doc: Total number of results pages.

members.name: currentPage
members.doc: Index of the current page. Indices are zero-based.

docs.summary: An object contains ListCards request data.

examples.title: Get a list of cards
body: /* Returns a promise that resolves to:

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of cards to retrieve. Defaults to `50`.

members.name: phaseId
members.doc: ID of phase to retrieve cards from. If omitted, will retrieve cards from all phases. Not to be used with `fetchOnlyArchived`.

members.name: fetchOnlyArchived
members.doc: Whether to retrieve only archived cards. Not to be used with `phaseId`.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of cards to skip before the retrieved items. Defaults to `0`.

members.name: order
members.doc: Ordering options.

docs.summary: An object containing options used when requesting a list of workflows or phases.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to retrieve. Defaults to `50` for phases and `100` for workflows.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip before the retrieved items. Defaults to `0`.

members.name: order
members.doc: Ordering options.

docs.summary: An object containing information used when moving a card.

examples.title: Move a card
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to void.

members.name: newPhaseId
members.doc: ID of the phase to move the card to. If omitted, the card remains in the same phase.

members.name: newPosition
members.doc: Position within the phase to move the card to. If omitted, the card is moved to the top of the phase.

docs.summary: An object containing information used when moving a phase.

examples.title: Move a phase
body: // Returns a promise that resolves to void.

members.name: workflowId
members.doc: ID of the workflow to move the phase to.

members.name: newPosition
members.doc: Position within the workflow to move the phase to.

docs.summary: Anobjectcontaining sort order options.

members.name: name
members.doc: Field to sort on.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Order of sort. Either `"asc"`or`"desc"`(defaults to`"asc"`).

docs.summary: An object containing information about a workflow.

docs.summary: An object containing a list of workflows and pagination info.

members.name: items
members.doc: List of workflows matching the list options.

members.name: length
members.doc: Number of items in the current results page.

members.name: totalCount
members.doc: Total number of workflows in the site.

members.name: pageSize
members.doc: Number of items returned per page with the current list options.
